title: Heart of Algebra

subtopics.heading: A. Linear Equations (One and Two Variables)
objectives: Solve one-variable linear equations with rational, integer, and decimal coefficients.
Solve literal equations for a specified variable.
Apply linear equations to word problems and real-life contexts.

subtopics.heading: B. Linear Inequalities
objectives: Solve and graph inequalities on a number line.
Interpret solution sets of inequalities.
Solve compound inequalities (AND/OR statements).
Solve absolute value inequalities and interpret solutions.

subtopics.heading: C. Linear Functions
objectives: Understand and calculate slope as rate of change.
Interpret slope and intercepts in context (e.g., economics, motion).
Represent linear relationships using tables, equations, and graphs.
Convert between different forms of linear equations (slope-intercept, standard, point-slope).

subtopics.heading: D. Systems of Linear Equations and Inequalities
objectives: Solve systems using graphing, substitution, and elimination.
Interpret solution as intersection point.
Model and solve systems in real-world applications.
Graph solution regions of systems of inequalities.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can solve and graph linear equations and inequalities.
Students can apply algebraic reasoning to real-life problems.
Students can model scenarios using linear systems.

title: Problem Solving & Data Analysis

subtopics.heading: A. Ratios, Rates, and Proportional Relationships
objectives: Solve problems involving ratios and unit rates.
Use proportion to scale quantities and solve map or model problems.
Interpret rates in real-life contexts (e.g., speed, density).

subtopics.heading: B. Percentages
objectives: Solve problems involving percentage change, increase, decrease, and error.
Calculate interest (simple and compound).
Apply percentages to tax, discounts, and commissions.

subtopics.heading: C. Unit Conversion and Dimensional Analysis
objectives: Convert between measurement systems (metric/customary).
Solve multi-step problems using dimensional analysis.

subtopics.heading: D. Data Interpretation
objectives: Read and interpret bar graphs, line graphs, pie charts, and tables.
Analyze scatterplots and identify correlations.
Interpret data distributions: box plots, histograms.

subtopics.heading: E. Descriptive Statistics
objectives: Calculate and interpret mean, median, mode, and range.
Understand variability: interquartile range and standard deviation.

subtopics.heading: F. Probability
objectives: Calculate probability of simple and compound events.
Use expected value in decision-making contexts.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can extract meaning from various data representations.
Students can apply ratios, percentages, and probabilities to real-world problems.

title: Passport to Advanced Math

subtopics.heading: A. Quadratic Functions and Equations
objectives: Solve quadratics by factoring, completing the square, and quadratic formula.
Analyze quadratic graphs: vertex, axis of symmetry, maximum/minimum.
Use the discriminant to determine the nature of roots.

subtopics.heading: B. Polynomial Operations
objectives: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide polynomials.
Identify end behavior and zeroes of polynomial functions.
Apply the Remainder and Factor Theorems.

subtopics.heading: C. Exponential Functions
objectives: Model exponential growth and decay.
Convert between exponential and logarithmic form.
Compare exponential and linear models.

subtopics.heading: D. Rational Expressions & Equations
objectives: Simplify rational expressions.
Solve rational equations and identify extraneous solutions.

subtopics.heading: E. Radicals and Rational Exponents
objectives: Simplify expressions involving radicals and fractional exponents.
Solve radical equations.

subtopics.heading: F. Functions: Notation, Composition, and Inverses
objectives: Use and interpret function notation.
Evaluate and combine functions.
Find and interpret inverses of functions.

subtopics.heading: G. Nonlinear Systems
objectives: Solve systems involving quadratic and linear functions.
Graph nonlinear systems and interpret solutions.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can manipulate and analyze complex expressions.
Students can solve and interpret polynomial, exponential, and rational equations.
Students can apply advanced functions to model problems.

title: Additional Topics in Math

subtopics.heading: A. Plane Geometry
objectives: Solve problems involving lines, angles, parallel lines, and transversals.
Understand triangle properties: congruence, similarity, angle sum.
Solve with polygon interior/exterior angle properties.

subtopics.heading: B. Circles
objectives: Identify parts of circles: radius, diameter, chords, arcs.
Apply formulas for circumference and area.
Solve problems involving arc length and sector area.
Understand relationships between angles, tangents, and chords.

subtopics.heading: C. Coordinate Geometry
objectives: Use the distance, midpoint, and slope formulas.
Write equations of lines and analyze graphs.
Interpret and analyze parabolas and circles in coordinate plane.

subtopics.heading: D. Trigonometry
objectives: Understand and apply SOHCAHTOA.
Use trigonometric ratios to solve right triangle problems.
Apply the Pythagorean identity.

subtopics.heading: E. Complex Numbers
objectives: Perform operations with complex numbers.
Understand and simplify powers of i.
Solve quadratic equations with complex solutions.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can solve geometric and trigonometric problems in plane and coordinate contexts.
Students can apply geometry and trig to real-world models.
Students understand the arithmetic and applications of complex numbers.
